intro: Moschosma tenuiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered moschosma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
